section.p: Log data is stored in the Elasticsearch database. Elasticsearch stores the data in indices. uses Elasticsearch Curator for managing data retention of these indices. Elasticsearch Curator jobs are automatically run by a Cron daemon that executes scheduled commands defined in a crontab configuration file. allows you to configure Elasticsearch Curator and the Cron daemon to define your data retention policies as required by your monitoring environment.
By default, an Elasticsearch index is automatically deleted in if it is older than 60 days. The delete job is executed every day at midnight.
Proceed as follows to change the data retention settings that were defined when installing the Monitoring Service:

li.p: Log in to the host where the Monitoring Service is installed.
Open the curator_action.yml file with your favorite editor. It defines how long you keep the data in the database.
Specify the time span after which you want indices to be removed. It is defined by the unit_count parameter in the action: delete_indices section.
Example for a time span of 30 days:
Edit the crontab configuration file which contains the list of commands to be run at the specified times. These commands are checked by the Cron daemon and then executed in the system background.
Edit the configuration file, for example, as follows:
To specify when to run a job, edit the entry in the file. The default is as follows:
Each line starts with five fields for defining the time/date, followed by a command, followed by a newline character (\n). The fields are separated by spaces, they must not contain spaces:

ul.li: Field 1 defines the minute. Use any integer from 0 to 59.
Field 2 defines the hour. Use any integer from 0 to 23 where 0 represents midnight.
Field 3 defines the day of the month. Use any integer from 1 to 31.
Field 4 defines the month. Use any integer from 1 to 12.
Field 5 defines the day of the week. Use any integer from 0 to 7 where 0 or 7 represent Sundays.

li.p: The above example will run /usr/bin/directory/command at 4:30 am on January 1st.

section.p: As soon as you have saved your changes, your new data retention policy takes effect.
For details on Elasticsearch Curator, refer to the Elasticsearch Curator documentation. Find details on configuring the Cron daemon, for example, in the Ubuntu Wiki.
